Module roborally
Package client.view

Class ProgrammingController

java.lang.Object
client.view.Controller
client.view.ProgrammingController
public class ProgrammingController
extends Controller
This class represents the programming phase, where the player chooses programming cards and puts them into his registers. Also the timer gets started by receiving related protocol from the server.
Author:
sarah

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox1
    This HBox shows 5 programming cards (if available) which the player can draw into his register.
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox1Background
    This HBox is behind the HBox that contains the available programming cards and displays default images
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox2
    This HBox shows 4 programming cards (if available) which the player can draw into his register.
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox2Background
    This HBox is behind the HBox that contains the available programming cards and displays default images
    private double heightHBox
    This is the height of one element of the HBox
    private int interval
    Interval means the interval of the timer that is normally 30 sec.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label programInfoLabel
    This Label contains information if the timer is running because of the player or that the player has to hurry.
    private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane timerAnchorPane
    This Pane contains the video of the hourglass
    private boolean timerEnded
    This boolean show if the timer has already ended, its default value is false.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label timerLabel
    This Label shows the countdown of the timer
    private double widthHBox
    This is the width of one element of the HBox

    Fields inherited from class client.view.Controller

    cardFormat, robotNames, viewClient, viewManager

    This automatically called method sets all layout settings of the HBoxes, creates the background and calculates the height and width of the HBoxes' contents.

    This method resets all elements and information that get changed during the programming phase.

    This method starts the programming phase by getting the available programming cards and displaying them in two HBoxes and also adds EventHandler to the pane that contains the imageView that also has an EventHandler to allow drag and dropping on the panes that are now children of the HBoxes.

    by getting protocol TimerStarted, the countdown in the label and the video will start.
    private void startVideo()

    • ProgrammingController

      public ProgrammingController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This automatically called method sets all layout settings of the HBoxes, creates the background and calculates the height and width of the HBoxes' contents.

    • settingsHBoxes

      private void settingsHBoxes​(javafx.scene.layout.HBox[] hBoxes)
      This method sets Spacing and Alignment for all hBoxes that occur to choosing programming cards
      Parameters:
      hBoxes - an Array that contains all hBoxes that should get layout

    • createBackground

      private void createBackground​(javafx.scene.layout.HBox hBox)
      This method creates the background of one HBox with underground card images. The whole HBox now is the default background for its overlapping HBox.
      Parameters:
      hBox - The HBox that should get images with background cards

    • startProgrammingPhase

      public void startProgrammingPhase​(java.util.ArrayList<CardType> cardList)
      This method starts the programming phase by getting the available programming cards and displaying them in two HBoxes and also adds EventHandler to the pane that contains the imageView that also has an EventHandler to allow drag and dropping on the panes that are now children of the HBoxes.
      Parameters:
      cardList - the list of cards the player can choose from

    • createImageView

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView createImageView​(CardType cardName)
      This method creates an Image from a CardType and adds an EventHandler that sets a DragBoard when a Drag gets detected and also the information that this imageView former place wasn't a register.
      Parameters:
      cardName - The CardType that should get transformed into an image
      Returns:
      the ImageView with EventHandler

    • checkDragAllowed

      private boolean checkDragAllowed​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, javafx.scene.input.Dragboard db)
      This method checks if dragging the image is allowed on a pane.

      If this is allowed depends on the facts if the DragBoard has the right DataFormat, if the ImageView that stores the dragged image is not null, that the former parent isn't the pane and that the pane is empty.

      Parameters:
      pane - the pane that should be the aim for dragging and dropping the imageView
      db - the DragBoard of the dragged event
      Returns:
      it returns if dragging the image is allowed

    • setOnDragOver

      private void setOnDragOver​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent e, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method gets called by dragging over a pane. It checks if the drag is allowed.
      Parameters:
      e - The DragEvent occurs by dragging over the pane
      pane - the pane that triggers the event

    • setOnDragExited

      private void setOnDragExited​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent e, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method adds the dropped image to the pane and removes it from its former parent. Also it adds again EventHandlers to that ImageView for the next tryout of dragging and dropping.
      Parameters:
      e - The DragEvent occurs when the drag get exited
      pane - the pane that triggers the event

    • setOnDragDetected

      private void setOnDragDetected​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
      This method adds an EventHandler to an ImageView which creates a DragBoard with DataFormat and sets information about the dragged imageView in the parent class.
      Parameters:
      imageView - the imageView that gets dragged

    • addDropHandling

      protected void addDropHandling​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      This method adds EventHandler to a pane by dragging over it, drag exited and drag done. When a drag is done it gets checked if the former position was a register than the protocol selectCard gets send wil null and the former register position.
      Parameters:
      pane - the pane that should get EventHandler

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer​(boolean allRegistersAsFirst)
      by getting protocol TimerStarted, the countdown in the label and the video will start.
      Parameters:
      allRegistersAsFirst -

    • startVideo

      private void startVideo()
      This method starts the video with the hourglass and adds it to the timeAnchorPane.

    • setTimer

      private void setTimer()
      This method sets the countdown and counts down from 30.

    • setTimerEnded

      public void setTimerEnded()
      This method sets the timer ended as soon as the protocol TimerEnded gets received.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This method resets all elements and information that get changed during the programming phase.
